H0.text: Cholesterol is a type of molecule that helps the plasma membrane keep its shape.

H1.text: Proteins are the type of molecules that help the plasma membrane keep its shape.

H2.text: Magnesium is a type of molecule that helps the plasma membrane keep its shape.

H3.text: Metabolic molecules help the plasma membrane keep its shape.

A4.text: It is required to build and maintain membranes and modulates membrane fluidity over the range of physiological temperatures.

A5.text: Through the interaction with the phospholipid fatty-acid chains, cholesterol increases membrane packing, which both alters membrane fluidity and maintains membrane integrity so that animal cells do not need to build cell walls (like plants and most bacteria).
